results.title: Dollar dance
results.brief_description: Wartime inflation and the role of price control are the subjects of this publicity trailer which employs single-frame animation of direct pen-drawing on 35mm film stock. McLaren featured an animated dancing dollar sign to encourage buying bonds, promote savings and warn of the dangers of inflation. The sound-track consists of spoken rhymed verses accompanied by an orchestra. Music Louis Applebaum.

results.title: Doled out
results.brief_description: A film about being unemployed and on the dole in Australia in 1978. In interviews and short dramatised sketches, the causes and effects of unemployment are examined in statements by people who are tired of being called “bludgers”. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Doing the bus stop
results.brief_description: A safety education program using song and dance routines pitched at 8-12 year olds, to demonstrate safe behaviour on and around buses in the country and city. Hale, a “radical” driver, takes Tess on a mystery tour to illustrate vital skills which will ensure the safety of children who use public transport.

results.title: Doing it right the fork lift way
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the do’s and dont’s of fork-lift driving. Illustrates both the correct and incorrect ways of manipulating the vehicle.

results.title: Doing business in Japan
results.creator_credit: Vision Associates and Business Council for International Understanding
results.brief_description: This film deals with the difficulties and complications that arise, in international business relationships, as a result of the cultural barriers that exist. The film is designed to be a teaching/training tool that can be used as the focus of a discussion or course of study.

results.title: Doin' what the crowd does
results.creator_credit: Jane Warrenbrand, Peter Wallach Enterprises, Scott Newman Foundation and Peter Wallach
results.brief_description: This uniquely animated musical film tells us that teenagers don’t necessarily have to follow the crowd, but can think and act for themselves. Exuberant young people dance, sing and perform athletic stunts on a city playground. Within the dance two peer groups interact, one enticing with drugs, alcohol and cigarettes, the other “doing what’s right for me”. The film is open-ended to provoke wide ranging discussion from the audience.

results.title: Dogs, cats and rabbits
results.brief_description: An amusing animated non-narrated film in three parts. Part one: 41 Barks - animated impressions of dogs, drawn and barked by Eliot Noyes Jr. Part two: Catsup - by Lana Hoban with music “Alley cat” by Frank Bjorn, played by Bent Fabric and a cast of five cats Part three: Rabbits, texture, shape and fun with drawings by Bill Stitt. Suitable for primary school level.

group_siblings.title: The Colonel
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jenifer Hooks, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS

results.title: Dog watch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales of Pluto”.
Pluto, the faithful sea dog, is given responsibility of looking after the ship while the crew goes on shore leave. All goes well until a very crafty, very hungry, wharf rat sneaks on board.

results.title: Dog's heaven
results.creator_credit: Short Film Studio and H Tyrlova
results.brief_description: Using wool fibre, a flexible material for animation, this film tells the story of a little black dog, slightly disappointed in his master, who has a brief sojourn in Dog’s Heaven. Instrumentation comes from three harpists, trumpeters, double bassists and a chorus.
